contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox scientist | name = Ottaviano-Fabrizio Mossotti | image = O F Mossotti.jpg | image_size = | caption = Ottaviano-Fabrizio Mossotti | birth_date = {{birth date|1791|04|17|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Novara]], [[Italy]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1863|03|20|1791|04|17|df=y}} | death_place = [[Pisa]], [[Italy]] | residence = | citizenship = | nationality = [[Italy|Italian]] | ethnicity = | field = [[Physics]], [[Mathematics]] | work_institution = | alma_mater = | doctoral_advisor = [[Vincenzo Brunacci]] | doctoral_students = [[Enrico Betti]] | known_for = | author_abbreviation_bot = | author_abbreviation_zoo = | prizes = | religion = | footnotes = }} [[File:Tomba di Ottaviano Fabrizio Mossotti.jpg|right|thumb|300px|Tomb of Mossotti, [[Pisa]].]] '''Ottaviano-Fabrizio Mossotti''' (1791-1863) was an [[Italy|Italian]] [[physicist]] exiled from Italy for his [[Liberalism|liberal]] ideas. He later taught [[astronomy]] and [[physics]] at the [[University of Buenos Aires]]. His name is associated with a type of multiple-element [[lens (optics)|lens]] correcting [[spherical aberration]] and [[Coma (optics)|coma]], but not [[chromatic aberration]]. The [[Clausius-Mossotti]] formula is partly named after him. Mossotti was Chair of Experimental Physics in Buenos Aires (1827-1835) and taught numerous Argentinian physicians his views on [[dielectric]]s, thereby becoming influential on the Argentine-German [[neurobiology|neurobiological]] tradition as regards electricity inside brain tissue, and later (after 1906) on this tradition's models of [[Standing wave|stationary waves]] in the [[hologram|interference]] of neural activity for short-term memory. He returned to Italy, participated in military actions after his age of sixty, and was appointed as Senator. There Mossotti also was influential on [[Hendrik Lorentz]]'s views on [[fundamental forces]], as well as more than five hundred mathematician students . ==External links== {{Commons}} * [http://www.lix.polytechnique.fr/~liberti/maths-history/mossotti/mossotti.html Biography] {{Authority control|VIAF=3252820}} {{Persondata | NAME = Mossotti, Ottaviano-Fabrizio | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 17 April 1791 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Novara]], [[Italy]] | DATE OF DEATH = 20 March 1863 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Pisa]], [[Italy]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mossotti, Ottaviano-Fabrizio}} [[Category:1791 births]] [[Category:1863 deaths]] [[Category:Italian physicists]] [[Category:People from Novara]] [[Category:University of Buenos Aires faculty]] {{Italy-scientist-stub}} {{Physicist-stub}}
